814683F58CC74EC0AB86F2314203AF19.description: make persuasive presentations that include a well-defined thesis, differentiate fact from opinion and support arguments with detailed evidence, examples, reasoning and persuasive language, anticipate and effectively answer listener concerns and counterarguments through the inclusion and arrangement of details, reasons, examples, and other elements while maintaining a reasonable tone

945F6DB12FF148B4AEEB6E83621D19BA.description: provide oral responses to literature that interpret a reading and provide insight, connect personal responses to the writer’s techniques and to specific textual references; make supported inferences about the effects of a literary work on its audience, support judgments through references to the text, other works, other authors, or personal knowledge

1FB784BE494A44D480300DB9001BBEF2.description: deliver descriptive presentations that establish a clear point of view on the subject, establish the presenter’s relationship with the subject, contain effective, factual descriptions of appearance, concrete images, shifting perspectives and sensory details

9A4832710A6643AEAF7F3F71865B423D.description: give research presentations that define a thesis, research important ideas, concepts, and direct quotations from significant information sources and paraphrase and summarize important perspectives on the topic, use a variety of research sources and distinguish the nature and value of each, present information on charts, maps and graphs

C48C923DF8BF45E1BA840EF58098E395.description: use narrative and descriptive strategies to support the presentation including relevant dialogue, specific action, physical description, background description, and comparison or contrast of characters

4894C359BBA94A918B395473D7D901B2.description: deliver narrative presentations such as biographical or autobiographical information that relate to a clear incident, event or situation including well-chosen details revealing the significance of the incident, event, or situation

C1C4A4D53BE1453C9A2EF8699045ED48.description: Identify the purpose of a presentation and apply appropriate presentation skills for the particular purpose

D06D597853BF473BAAEEAFBDA45AD937.description: incorporate digital media and visual displays of data when helpful and in a manner that strengthens the presentation

56C4574A4BCA4FA4A41982F3C8CAC337.description: use audience feedback, including both verbal and non-verbal cues, to reconsider and modify the organizational structure and/or to rearrange words and sentences for clarification of meaning

3ADD4301B92B405BAD11520BE6A5B0CF.description: adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate

BD483890806C4EE8A63F0879D2BEC0CE.description: use precise language, action verbs, sensory details, appropriate and colorful modifiers, and the active rather than passive voice in ways that enliven oral presentations

1B697C284F074BF38504EF18BE9DFD54.description: use appropriate grammar, word choice, enunciation, vocabulary, voice modulation, expression, tone and pace during formal presentations

8BB7F3C59E7146B6B97CF4BA7A508151.description: outline the organization of a speech, including an introduction, transitions, previews, and summaries, a logically developed body and an effective conclusion

C18F04913FAF4D4FAA0E1D02A8AEFF50.description: Present information emphasizing salient points with pertinent descriptions and details, using appropriate manners and speech, adequate volume, clear pronunciation, and use of visuals

EFA9AA0B7030423AA9E7CF77FA65CF19.description: analyze oral interpretations of literature, including language choice and delivery and the effect of interpretations on the listener

C0E0A6974D6045E5AEEB96EDB79EA035.description: analyze oral interpretations of literature, including language choice and delivery and the effect of interpretations on the listener

A8D852F1D8A6494F82748C3395F45C5D.description: evaluate the credibility of a speaker, including whether the speaker has hidden agendas or presents slanted or biased material

6B718991B8FA4761A3667A253B996A31.description: interpret and evaluate the various ways in which visual image makers communicate information and affect impressions and opinions

462EC64C18E74ABCBC44EC35E775DE74.description: explain how the information presented clarifies and contributes to a topic or issue under study

B416C4868D164489B83D91163DA34579.description: Analyze, evaluate, and interpret information presented in visual or multimodal formats

A929B3902DC6490D90840A097E78AB97.description: demonstrate respect for the views of others assessing new ideas against Catholic doctrine

DD138544B47248569C90A1C8FBA6D721.description: ensure a hearing for the range of positions on an issue

B8228A3A873E4191BB447EC85A84F2D2.description: ensure a hearing for the range of positions on an issue

2476D99EF0A642AC933B5A95FECCB8C5.description: advance a discussion by asking questions, responding precisely, and sharing factual knowledge and observations

A5C1D1D4FE52412A8FE0263D8E03010C.description: cooperate with peers to set clear goals and deadlines

AE2BDF43E60E41C39DDD0E48F8550B29.description: ask questions concerning the speaker’s content, delivery and attitude toward a subject

286AFEB5F2994C3DB30D0EF9AE7E96D0.description: prepare for discussions by completing reading or conducting research and explicitly draw on that material in discussion

DF6612A935E545DAA1500C2F7694ED97.description: Initiate and engage in group discussions on eighth grade topics and texts being studied in class

D2245346BFF64E019A5921DEBB816014.description:
Speaking and Listening: Comprehension and Collaboration
Students adjust their use of spoken language to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences and for different purposes.

B8891914C4D34652B135308561EF3E4A.description: identify and properly use parallelism to present ideas in a series and items juxtaposed for emphasis

7D313115A2F84F56B5362C349F707382.description: use a variety of complex transitions between sentences to build coherency within paragraphs

3B9196DB121840A19427047E9F3E55B0.description: place phrases and clauses within a sentence avoiding misplaced and dangling modifiers

94CB449FC3354DFDACFBB6F708A14A85.description: use effective coordination and subordination of ideas, including both main ideas and supporting details in single sentences to express complete thoughts and present lively and effective personal style

4ECA3102181042FFBDE973463893E3CC.description: use simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences

EC397EC03351480EA38BBB8EEA95FFB0.description: Use appropriate and varied sentence types to develop paragraphs

2F8037063261493693C0318BBB411D02.description: demonstrate the use of quotation marks with emphasis on direct quotations

B1EBA01788C84A6193820FCC953DE687.description: use a semi-colon, colon, hyphen, parentheses, bracketing, and ellipses appropriately

4F441C5844D8455B8A414E8EAA9294CF.description: Use a comma after a dependent clause to begin a sentence and after introductory words to set off interrupters, nouns of direct address and appositives

05968E7E53C549EC848347CFE1A44813.description: Observe conventions of capitalization, punctuation, and spelling

DFD29243E5734281B6812D994D0A9F43.description: Identify and use verbals and verbal phrases (gerunds, participles, and infinitives)

72A57CC146AC4156BC8B0FA2E31D0EDC.description: Identify and use identify and use modifiers such as adjective and adverb phrases; identify the words they modify

CE9C14A6978F404BA1768C989F5C232D.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood

751D4D683C834836BD6D1FE0B7D384FE.description: Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional and subjunctive moods

174C266BB8AF4D09BDE14B9BE208E054.description: Identify and properly use present perfect, past perfect, and future perfect verb tenses

FAAA5B9343994F6FB98A28C23822BEF9.description: demonstrate understanding of and use of predicate nominative and predicate adjective (predicate nouns or subject complements)

9067405ADBEA4212A713A00A8D9D45AA.description: Use relative pronouns, intensive/reflexive, possessive, demonstrative and indefinite pronouns

FBA9FB16104D4628BFA8F022422AAE3D.description: Demonstrate agreement of antecedent with pronoun

38093D93E9DC446CAEFEA716109F716F.description: Use nouns with particular emphasis on concrete, abstract and collective nouns as a part of speech

396BEAC74A4E4D94B99A57957AF796E6.description: Observe conventions of grammar and usage in writing and speaking

27E663CED64A424590D7B3CBF9BF2D61.description:
Grammar and Usage
Students adjust their use of spoken, written, and visual language (e.g., conventions, style, vocabulary) to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences and for different purposes.

7B1886C5716E40BEA12294578555647D.description: Use technology in an appropriate way, including the internet, to produce, publish and interact with others about writing, including linking to and citing online sources in order to avoid plagiarism.

BD2F0B61A171436DAA2AC2B1333C572D.description: Provide details, reasons, and examples, arranging them effectively by anticipating and answering reader concerns and counterarguments

C69DDE029D2C4D0F94D45C5212964B80.description: Ppresent detailed evidence, examples, and reasoning to support effective arguments using emotional, logical and ethical appeals

B716B68779164366BCB9ABD6F6538687.description: Write persuasive compositions that include a well- defined thesis that makes a clear and knowledgeable appeal

92E0EBC180084B7882951F72E092F7D7.description: Reference standards in Reading Literature and Informational Text- Comprehension, Response and Analysis (beginning on page 29)

2C311C95BA7144AD9D709238830C2E54.description: Develop an interpretation that shows careful reading, understanding and insight

502401A57B2F49FA8B59C3B200EB2295.description: Draw from text to support analysis and reflection describing what has been learned

A6C7C26E1DDF442BAA0588589BB9BC1B.description: Write in response to literary or informational sources

759A5BA8156F42D09DC1CF528A1BA02F.description: Provide basic bibliographic information using MLA or APA format

AE2FAB89CE6C4667BA01C1CC894C257B.description: Demonstrate the distinction between one’s own ideas from the ideas of others

2A950E551C2B4FC4B74C71BE096EAE70.description: Demonstrate that sources have been evaluated for accuracy, bias and credibility

7E8B7C914C6146FE89D72EA237FB07B2.description: Use a variety of resources and documents

DC7A0D4EFCD5432EBA26D33F02C4C89D.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects

F6B0F444293944E19FC799A827B48477.description: Gather information from experience as well as print and digital resources, take notes on sources, categorize evidence, restate, summarize or paraphrase information

F0422208B9344E72999E6D6282AAED82.description: Perform focused research tasks that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic using several sources

0CC5872E2990417EA654EEA4077C4CDB.description: Use formatting techniques (headings, fonts, font sizes, etc) in technical writing to aid in style and comprehension

ABAE41E0128947FA99AC258DA42A05F2.description: Use MLA (or APA) style for bibliography

30F35D9C09EF4EA4BD64658626319B3C.description:
Identify the need for correct citation of
sources to avoid plagiarism

B486A934EB374BA2887B6D6371623C18.description: Provide a conclusion that follows logically from the information or explanation presented

3024C7751B57491790860127CAB20B5E.description: Use straightforward language to create an objective style, appropriate for a reader seeking information

3EB2814CF9AA44ACA603C59C00ECAD06.description: Use appropriate links and varied sentence structures to join and clarify ideas.

7CE39E94DD90407FA2E7149457E1F9E8.description: Develop the topic with relevant and accurate facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples

A43C23DD498D49F59FF4E479FDF8DFED.description: Introduce a topic, state a thesis, organize information appropriate to the purpose, use strategies such as definition, classification, compare/ contrast, and cause/effect and offer evidence to support arguments and conclusions

23B36D205BD04BAF86236FF352FE23A3.description: Write expository, informative/explanatory, descriptive, and technical texts

7AAB0A2E07D846E1A55125B67D9CAE60.description: Provide a satisfying conclusion that follows from events, experiences, or ideas

7AE0F40CBC8B4884B931AA7F3F8AD79A.description: Choose words and phrases to develop the events, experiences, and ideas precisely to create a particular mood or attitude

7B3305EA602E4856970E31CFF11C1ED6.description: Use a variety of techniques to convey sequence, shift from one time frame or setting to another and/or show the relationships among the events or experiences

A2BC18C99E70497DB6967FD7CEBC49CC.description: Use narrative and descriptive strategies, including relevant dialogue, specific action, physical description, background description, and comparison or contrast of characters

B1C39BC4E7A149569CBC49722018C15E.description: Write biographical, autobiographical and short stories that tell about an incident, event, or situation, using details; reveal the significance of, or writer’s attitude about the subject

28CF43021E934417ACB5E254F703D341.description: Develop narrative elements (e.g., setting, event sequence, complex major and minor characters) using relevant sensory details and devices such as dialogue, suspense and the naming of narrative action

0A6BBCB6F0D24833B258CD047B567B7F.description:
Engage and orient the reader by
establishing a context and point of view, and have an organized sequence of events or experiences

BD9014A91C9846E28F017CA35C22890F.description: Email and electronic notes that portray the appropriate tone

A481603DD8064238B76F2760FE1EC517.description: Memos that portray the appropriate tone

77186BEEA32C4D1196B9998152F3CFFF.description: Use symbols, pictures and charts to convey thoughts and meaning in a written document

D2564229855B41068AE6BF197CA11FB3.description: Use varied word choices to make all types of writing interesting and more precise for the reader

0852B496A59542A6AC82279711DFEF83.description: Write for different purposes; information, persuasion, description, and to a specific audience or person, adjusting tone and style as necessary

E37D85B1D9534E4C8B30EAD22AB3934D.description: Support theses or conclusions with analogies, paraphrases, quotations, expert opinions, and similar devices and evidence

198F5145A3D04DF698ADD7B28164C2F5.description: Compose paragraphs that are based on information, flow from reading and describe events and observations

79D5CA08D09C43D1A9659AAB890D3D3F.description: Apply spelling and grammar rules to all written work

E79A9173452E4023BEB775A66A665F39.description: Demonstrate the ability to use punctuation to affect meaning and flow in a written piece

8654027FC1D14C1681BFC1613CC60F67.description: Emphasize content as well as mechanics in written work

278EC83F2A974E608B817B6D9FA7C168.description: Edit and proofread one’s own writing, as well as that of others, using an editing checklist or set of rules, with specific examples of corrections of frequent errors

7BB2F23FD93940438773B82F62EB76C7.description: Use strategies of note-taking, outlining, and summarizing to impose structure on composition text

B3DE8A0694AA4BE09870291178268248.description: Reflect on how well questions of purpose have been addressed and revise writing as needed.

0868DFF2C7E647B1AB99A39158E817AD.description: Discuss ideas for writing, keep a list of ideas, and use a graphic organizer to plan writing

90ADB2A12F8C41DCB0C474F457DB6FB7.description: Collaborate with adults and peers throughout the writing process to enhance ideas and techniques

F101EC96996F45C09335375FC1BAB7B2.description: Revise writing to improve the organization and consistency of ideas within and between paragraphs to improve meaning and clarity.

17267641E0874246BC16609E5789568B.description: Engage in a writing process of planning, reviewing, revising, editing, rewriting, evaluating or trying a new approach

B6A367F0F1694AF8A9B36898BE2420B3.description: Polished writing – engaged in the full writing process (plan, research, reflect, revise; first draft, second draft, final)

4B64DE5DD04D4E76A7829B8C459A19B0.description: Readable writing – intended for an audience (essay test question, assignment –short response answers)

50F96AA73FA24363AFC6A4E0311A670E.description: Provisional writing – brief, daily writing that supports learning (brainstorming, spontaneous, routine tasks)

12D8A30563BB4A34A6144B43E596568E.description: Write routinely for a range of tasks, purposes and audiences, over short and extended time frames

DC984979246547ECB62B68CB8B2A3237.description: Produce grade appropriate coherent, clear, and legible writing in which organization, development, substance and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

45F17D22E9F5411285CB918798C66D1D.description:
Writing – Processes and Features
Students employ a wide range of strategies as they write and use different writing process elements appropriately to communicate with different audiences for a variety of purposes.

B3515AD9A3264845B259F3E4FFBD012A.description: elf-select appropriate texts for research and personal reading

4CA1201AB4E148AE8E26115D7A2F8517.description: Expand the use of reference materials for gathering information and develop rubric for evaluating validity of sources from web sources.

95BAA02CD2BC495EB14DF47F9DA77B96.description: Compare and contrast how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different interpretations of facts.

92D626863F68403897FEF0529FB66E05.description: Assess the similarities and differences between two or more texts on the same subject.

7548B2FC1B8D4791A1796C1CC16E0BB7.description: Evaluate an argument’s claim and reasoning as well as the degree to which evidence supports each claim.

6770A8E672344525931E3FED922C4BB4.description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, propaganda, and reasoned judgment presented

987C2BA68AF74169A332B7ECB987C044.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., text, multimedia, video) to present a particular topic

2F05F328254D40E8A12AF86FE220829F.description: Compare and contrast the accounts of a subject in different mediums (e.g. person’s life story told in print, video, or multimedia)

F0A34D3D1D4D45F38E6BD681F4050A57.description: Extend awareness of world cultures and historical perspectives through diverse texts, including first-person materials, accounts of historical events, documents and historical fiction.

8C1786258488445C8C9624AFE6893B7D.description: Compare and contrast the works of various authors

4CF5CF05D474495BB45399AC68D16D75.description: Analyze a work of literature showing how it reflects the heritage, tradition, attitudes, and beliefs of the author

AE0682A752C54234A05CD636E6A138D9.description: Evaluate, critique, and interpret a variety of literature from different eras and cultures and authors

B6BFE6A706674F279A76430B0059997C.description: Analyze how an author introduces, illustrates, and elaborates on two or more significant ideas in a text, including how the relationship between ideas is expressed

AB59E36C99034570A590D2991F1A58D0.description: Determine the causes or reasons that link different events, ideas, or information in a text, drawing on key details.

CEAF9E7CA47A4847A54337CF85EDB51B.description: Analyze significant literary devices, such as metaphor, symbolism, dialect or quotations, and irony, which define a writer’s style and use those elements to interpret the work

931C680AF7554A6A84222D05185C08B3.description: Interpret figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases, as they are used in text, to explain meaning

1611EF7A5958407EA64427A38BEF4939.description: Identify and analyze recurring themes that appear frequently across traditional and contemporary works

F561A7528CAE48EE99C715ECFDB67AD6.description: Identify and analyze features and themes conveyed through characters, actions and images

7B500981046F4DD0905E237171987F19.description: Analyze the relevance of setting and compare and contrast the motivations and reactions of literary characters from different historical eras.

3D7CF8C3663A445ABFDC9DF67A05E4BE.description: Evaluate the structural elements of the plot such as subplots, parallel episodes, and climax; the plot’s development; and the way in which conflicts are addressed and resolved.

660F9593F11B49FCB0B4455B3184806B.description: Describe how a story’s plot unfolds (in a series of episodes or as a problem to be solved) as well as how characters adapt or change as they move toward a resolution

2F6F99E4B42E468FBC19A1BA1F98331A.description: Apply Catholic values, virtues, Catholic Social Teachings in evaluation of literary themes and plots

7ABEDFBD87384A8E963CAC70B0A083D2.description: Interpret text using background knowledge, literary elements and inferences.

355DFF44CB4D4D09903BBA196CF38193.description: Student will read a variety of texts and genres to build an interest in leisure, academic, and informational reading

19B0D3936D334E0FA0E705802A701951.description:
Reading Literature and Informational Text - Comprehension, Response, and Analysis
Students read a wide range of print and non-print texts to build an understanding of texts, of themselves, and of the cultures of the United States and the world; to acquire new information; to respond to the needs and demands of society and the workplace; and for personal fulfillment. Among these texts are fiction and nonfiction, classic and contemporary works, and literature from many periods.

9701E35C88304AEBB66ED6E7570AC2CA.description: Expository critique - Assess evidence of nonfiction and informational text

B42AD615420343C5AF0FA7A3E71379D6.description: Expository critique - Assess evidence of nonfiction and informational text

07D6C3B997C945D6A44C25D91337AC39.description: Use information from a variety of documents (Vatican, consumer, primary documents) to explain a situation or decision and to solve a problem

12AA278AC53545B593C6C54486ADC7F3.description: Synthesize understanding of texts by creating outlines, notes, diagrams, summaries, or reports

359AC610E3C34C7DA0309FC8B85A33FE.description: Compare the original text to a summary to determine whether the summary accurately describes the main ideas, includes important details and conveys the underlying meaning

1BC206DF063A47ECB5EB46DBAF793A3A.description: Draw conclusions, make reasonable statements and inferences a text, supporting them with accurate examples

678B5AA51F584C529A5392AF84975B0F.description: Analyze the structure, format and purpose of informational materials

021C2D826E8B4DAEB31172AB0CB76F9C.description: Compare the point of from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first and third person narrations

94B0B404DB49430C92CCBE3E318D3514.description: Compare and contrast the cultural context of a text with another similar text.

D283AD81412A4B4A8F628CF8241F6AC4.description: Identify how a narrator’s point of view influences how events are described

FFD3B1C2D55F4A428362D65ED45D30C2.description: Determine point of view and cultural context on which media is portrayed

8B913EBAA4FC41C48021B9DB8DA95222.description: Analyze, in detail, the structure of a specific paragraph of text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept

860B4C0BEE0E460F84B6D9D3F18602DA.description: Compare poetry with conventional structure, such as a free verse poem

A10FFD20223041E4B3C7AA14D2873BC1.description: Analyze how text structure affects meaning, including chronological order, order of importance and special order

28F065E619104C5F99ECDBE0B0AB1220.description: Describe the structure an author uses to organize specific text

F778718174034C3EB9CB5C91F286805F.description: Compare and contrast literature from diverse cultural backgrounds

8B0BCD54C2084493863C5FC63D058A49.description: Explain how a difference in the perspective or knowledge of characters and audience (e.g. created through the device or dramatic irony) produces suspense or humor

DA2DDBCAAACA449E8BDB8230AF114A4A.description: Explain how author’s purpose for writing influences the contents of the selection (e.g., inform, entertain, persuade)

22B8E0D6AE0B47A58E35D237A72F4D02.description: Determine and articulate the relationship between the purposes and characteristics of different forms of poetry

C18C747A47684B28A1434944A5B1A145.description: Distinguish major categories and features of literary genre (e.g. stories from poems, fiction from non-fiction)

949AE461EDDA40AE9830B7B824637B57.description: Compare and contrast the structural features of media and use the features to obtain information

2165EEB9754E4BBA9A9FF7C5BCD8005E.description: Utilize the structural features of media and use the features to obtain information

C602BCE2D3CD438D82612BBC864155AF.description:
Reading Literature and Informational Texts - Craft and Structure
Students apply knowledge of language structure, language conventions (e.g., spelling and punctuation), media techniques, figurative language, and genre to create, critique, and discuss print and non-print texts.

472C0BF2DE974A538570ABF705E0ABA8.description: Explain the comparison an author makes through metaphors, allusions, or analogies in a text and analyze how those comparisons contribute to a meaning.

26EF8B9257244C0CBA20B82B0D9B6196.description: Identify analogies: word and synonym, word and antonym, part and whole

35FEED9FEBF54049B46864C7B23948C1.description: Distinguish a word from other words with similar denotations but different connotations

435A9C84B4F941339BF5E587D4F04DFD.description: Trace the network of uses and meaning that different words have and the interrelationships among the meanings and uses

C7CBB205347541FB87B4B56289595AF0.description: Understand the influence the etymology of words has on meaning and vocabulary expansion

E380F45829204922BD66FDC26C284957.description: Interpret various figures of speech (e.g., verbal irony, puns) relevant to particular texts

ECBD3B86DF904AA8843CD3F7E4933519.description: Verify the preliminary determination of a word’s meaning (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or looking up a word in the dictionary)

C45297BD4F1D4946A3BA2078F4040BF3.description: Use known prefixes, root words, and suffixes as a clue to meaning of an unknown word with the same root (precede, recede,secede)

D188124469D04BAD8701101F51465D2D.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown or multiple-meaning words through the use of one or more strategies, such as using, semantic clues (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text); using syntactic clues (e.g., the word’s position of function in a sentence); analyzing the word’s sounds, spelling, and meaningful parts; and consulting reference materials, both print and digital

E21AAE9AB185482B94DBFBDF797B5BA0.description: Determine word meanings (based on grade eight reading)

3ACBB3516BA143BEBC6329EFCC003201.description:
Vocabulary Development and Word Analysis
Students apply a wide range of strategies to comprehend, interpret, evaluate, and appreciate texts. They draw on their prior experience, their interactions with other readers and writers, their knowledge of word meaning and of other texts, their word identification strategies and understanding textual features (e.g. sound-letter correspondence, sentence structure, context, graphics).
